shortdesc.ph: Occurs each time the SDK receives a video frame sent by the remote user.

p.codeblock: boolean onRenderVideoFrame(String channelId, int uid, VideoFrame videoFrame);
virtual bool onRenderVideoFrame(const char* channelId, rtc::uid_t remoteUid, VideoFrame& videoFrame) = 0;
final void Function(String channelId, int remoteUid, VideoFrame videoFrame)? onRenderVideoFrame;

section.p: After you successfully register the video frame observer, the SDK triggers this callback each time it receives a video frame. In this callback, you can get the video data before encoding. You can then process the data according to your particular scenarios.

ul.li: This function only applies to the scenarios where the video processing mode is .
Due to the limitations of Flutter, this callback does not support writing processed video data back to the SDK.

plentry.pd: The ID of the remote user who sends the current video frame.
